00032 bool BaseEANUPC::verifyContent ( const string *content )
00033 {
00034         string ASCIIstring = "0123456789";
00035         set< char > setOfASCII;
00036         set< char > ::iterator iter;
00037         for ( int nn = 0; nn < ASCIIstring.length( ); nn++ ) 
00038         {
00039                 setOfASCII.insert( ASCIIstring.at( nn ) );
00040         }
00041         for ( int nn = 0; nn < content->length( ); nn++ ) 
00042         {
00043                 iter = setOfASCII.find( content->at( nn ) );
00044                 if (iter == setOfASCII.end( ) ) 
00045                 {
00046                         cerr << "You are trying to encode " << content->at( nn ) << " which is not supported by this barcode type." << endl;
00047                         return false;
00048                 }
00049         }
00050         cout << "Passed content check" << endl;
00051         return true;
00052 }

00069 void BaseEANUPC::encodeCheckCharacter ( const string *data )
00070 {       
00071         int multiples[12] = {1,3,1,3,1,3,1,3,1,3,1,3};
00072         int accumulator = 0;
00073         int count = NULL;
00074         int dsl = data->length();
00075         
00076         switch (dsl) 
00077         {
00078                 case 12:
00079                         count = 0;
00080                         break;
00081                 case 11:
00082                         count = 1;
00083                         break;
00084                 case 7:
00085                         count = 5;
00086                         break;
00087                 default:
00088                         break;
00089         }
00090         
00091         for ( int ii = 0; ii < dsl; ii++, count++) 
00092         {
00093                 string tempstring  = data->substr(ii,1);
00094                 char aChar = tempstring.at(0);
00095                 accumulator += ( atoi(&aChar) * multiples[count] );
00096         }
00097         
00098         int checkdigit = ( 10 - ( accumulator % 10 ) );
00099         if (checkdigit == 10) 
00100         {
00101                 checkdigit = 0;
00102         }
00103         
00104         string *newString = new string ( *data );
00105         
00106         stringstream output4;
00107         output4 << checkdigit;
00108         output4.flush( );
00109         newString->append( output4.str( ) );
00110         completedDataString = *newString;
00111         cout << "Amended string: " << completedDataString << endl;
00112         encodeSymbol( newString );
00113 }
